page.title: 07THE YAIR HISTORY
page.content: There were many different people who owned the Charter of Selkirk. This area was a fishery and was known as Piscatrum De Seleschirche and had an enclosure to catch fish. It is still used for fishing but the fishing is for sport. The Charter was the Catra De Yhar. William the Lion endorsed the gift and in 1247 Alexander II issued a special Charter of Yair. Amongst the owners of the Charter was Mr. Thomas Kerr, he owned the Charter whilst being feud with the Scots. A feud is a lasting hostility between peoples. Up stream of the bridge is a cauld which was used to divert the river for power to run a sawmill. It is now powered by electricty.
